Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/france
Title: France | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that we have a number of funding opportunities, including: EU-guaranteed loans to Master's students going to or coming from France offered by two French banks: Banque Populaire and Caisse d’Epargne a postgraduate loan available to all UK/EU students to help you pay for your Master’s course. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Our university has a number of Exchange Partnerships with French institutions. Students from these partner institutions may be eligible to participate in an exchange programme. Download pour exchange partners list for more details: Student exchange partners 2017–18 461.67 KB Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have: Baccalauréat or Option International du Baccalauréat (OIB), Brevet de Technicien (BT), Brevet Professionnel (BP) with a minimum aggregate mark 11/20. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 14 or above within your Baccalauréat for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: a Diplôme d'Ingénieur/ Licence / Grade de Licence/ Licence Professionnelle/ Diplôme National de Technologie Spécialisé/ Maitrisecan with a minimum score 11/20 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 16 or above within your Baccalauréat for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives The University of Westminster's representatives in France can help you with all stages of the admissions process. Our representatives: StudiesUp W: studiesup.com If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . Title: Gambia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% Higher Diploma from a recognised college in Gambia For possible entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) , you will typically need to have the following: Bachelor's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Master's degree from the University of Gambia with at least 60%/CQPA 2.70/Grade B- average Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need a Master's degree with at least 67%/CQPA 3.30/Grade B+ average, and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need at least 80%/CQPA 4.00/Grade A average For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Diplome des Etudes Superieures / Maîtrise with a score of 12-13/20 / Assez Bien from a recognised institution in Congo.  Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need 14-15/20 / Bien, and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need 16/20 / Très Bien. Title: Ghana | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . We are very pleased that our Communications alumna Shirley Botchway has recently been named the new Minister for Foreign Affairs and Corporate Finance Law alumnus Dominic Nitiwul nominated for the position of Defence Minister in Ghana. The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: General Certificate of Education Advanced Level a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% Higher National Diploma – Upper Credit or Distinction For possible entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) , you will typically need to have the following: University Diploma (CGPA of 3.0+) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor's degree with a CGPA 2.51/4.0 (2.0/4.0 post-2013) from a recognised Ghanaian institution. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need a CGPA 3.25/4.0 (3.0/4.0 post-2013), and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need a CGPA of 3.75/4.0 (3.6/4.0 post-2013). a degree from a recognised Ghanaian university may be accepted as evidence of English proficiency for some of our postgraduate programmes (with the exception of Master's courses in Life Sciences) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or a Vietnamese institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% Successful completion of one year at a recognised university in Vietnam with a minimum GPA of 2.6/4.0 or 7.0/10/0 or above depending on the subject area and the institution attended A levels or International Baccalaureate (see course pages for details) To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: a Higher National Diploma (HND) with upper credit or distinction For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a Bachelor's degree Bang Tot Nghiep Dai Hoc with an average score of 7 or higher a Master's degree from Vietnam Applicants without a first degree but with 5-7 years relevant work experience may also be considered on an individual basis for some Master's programmes For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: India | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . We have a dedicated team with a base in New Delhi who can be contacted via [email protected] or 011 42124112 for all your application queries. Westminster has over 900 alumni based in India and worldwide and in January 2014 we launched the Westminster India Alumni Network, designed to link graduating students with alumni back in India for placement, internship and mentoring opportunities. Please contact us for more information. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: HSC XII: CBSE, ICSE, Kolkata, or Tamil Nadu boards with an overall average of 70% or above* HSC XII: West Bengal board with an overall average of 58% or above* HSC XII: Maharashtra or Gujarat boards with an overall average of 75% or above* HSC XII: All other state boards with an overall average of 80%+ or above* a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or an Indian institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% For consideration for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) you will typically need to have the following: UK Higher National Diploma (HND) with Distinctions and Merits Note: If you are studying at one of Westminster partners in India we may have an agreement allowing entry into the second or third year. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. We may also accept high X and XII scores in English from CBSE, ICSE and Maharashtra boards. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: 3-year Bachelor's degree (Honours) from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 55% or CGPA 6.0 out of 10.0 depending on the university 3-year Bachelor's degree (Science) from an accredited university with a minimum overall from 58% or CGPA 6.5 out of 10.0 depending on the university 4-year Bachelor's degree (Eng/Tech) from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 55% or CGPA 6.0 out of 10.0 depending on the university For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. We may also accept high X and XII scores in English from CBSE, ICSE and Maharashtra boards For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: Zambia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a Master's degree with a GPA 2.5/4.0 from a recognised Zambian institution. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need a GPA 3.0/4.0, and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need a GPA of 3.5/4.0. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor degree or Licence with at least 12/13 Assez Bien (out of 20) or CGPA 2.8 (out of 4.0) from a recognised institution in Cameroon.  Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need 14/15 Bien (out of 20) or CGPA 3.3 (out of 4.0), and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need 16+ Tres Bien (out of 20) or CGPA 3.7 (out of 4.0) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Title: Australia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: High School Certificate and an appropriate ATAR/Overall Position (Queensland) score, as follows: Capital Territory: Australia Capital Territory Year 12 Certificate New South Wales: Higher School Certificate Northern Territory: Northern Territory Certificate of Education / Northern Territory Certificate of Education and Training Queensland: Queensland Certificate of Education South Australia: South Australian Certificate of Education Tasmania: Tasmanian Certificate of Education Victoria: Victorian Certificate of Education Western Australia: Western Australia Certificate of Education To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: Associate Degree (2 years) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor Honours degree with at least a credit pass (60%+) from a recognised Australian institution. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need a distinction pass (70-79%), and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need a high distinction pass (80%+). Holders of a three-year Bachelor degree (Ordinary) may be considered for entry onto some postgraduate diploma or Master's courses where the applicant has very high grades or additional relevant work experience. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/canada
Title: Canada | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Westminster also has a number of exchange partnerships with Canadian institutions. For further details see our Global Westminster pages. As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or year with us in London. Canadian student Loans The University of Westminster can support your application for the Canadian State Loan to help you with your tuition fee and living costs. For more information please see Canada Student Loans Program and Provincial and Territorial Student Financial Assistance Offices website. Please note that the institutional code for our Cavendish Campus is PUHH, for Marylebone Campus - PUGM and for Regent Campus - PUHA. If you need further advice, please contact our Student Funding Office . For information about private Canadian Loans please see the Global Education Management Services website. Accreditation in Canada To practise law in Canada, after completing your LLB degree in the UK you will need to demonstrate your competence to the National Committee on Accreditation (NCA). The NCA will assess your qualifications, taking into account your academic and professional background, and will make recommendations regarding further exams or legal education required. This will depend on how many steps towards qualifications in the UK have been taken (ie. LLB, LLB plus LPC/BVC, training contract) and the grades you have obtained. Upon successful completion of these requirements, the NCA will issue a Certificate of Qualification. The NCA does not assess individuals who wish to become members of Barreau du Québec or the Chambre des notaires du Québec . Studying Law at Westminster Westminster Law School has a long history of welcoming Canadian students to study with us in central London. Due to our shared Common Law heritage the study of Law in the UK is similar to that of Canada. Teaching is by lectures and seminars for each subject. Our personal tutor system allows each student to have a member of staff who is there to provide one-to-one support during your studies. Westminster Law School also has several contacts with London Law firms and other businesses employing Law graduates, as well as a dedicated careers service to support you as you begin your professional life. In the UK, students enter undergraduate law programmes immediately after high school, embarking on a three-year Law LLB Honours degree. We welcome Canadian students either directly after completing high school or after you have graduated from your first degree. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below as a guide. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Canadian High School Diploma / Ontario Secondary School Diploma / Diplôme d'Études Collègiales (DEC) – please see the grade requirements table below. Satisfactorily completion of one year of a college/university program with GPA of 2.8 To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: College diploma (2 or 3 years) Grade requirements UK A-level Alberta / Manitoba / New Brunswick / Newfoundland / Northwest T. / Nova Scotia / P.Edward Island / Saskatchewan / Yukon British Columbia Ontario Quebec AAA 80% in 5 grade 12 courses 80% in 5 grade 12 courses (AAAAA) 80% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 80% overall average in DEC AAB 75% in 5 grade 12 courses 75% in 5 grade 12 courses (AAABB) 75% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 75% overall average in DEC ABB 75% in 5 grade 12 courses 75% in 5 grade 12 courses (ABBBB) 75% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 75% overall average in DEC BBB 70% in 5 grade 12 courses 70% in 5 grade 12 courses (BBBBB) 70% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 70% overall average in DEC BBC 70% in 5 grade 12 courses 70% in 5 grade 12 courses (BBBBB) 70% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 70% overall average in DEC BCC 65% in 5 grade 12 courses 65% in 5 grade 12 courses (BBBCC) 65% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 65% overall average in DEC CCC 65% in 5 grade 12 courses 65% in 5 grade 12 courses (BBBCC) 65% in 6 grade 12 University/College Preparation courses 65% overall average in DEC For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . Title: Mozambique | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: Bakalavr or Specialised Diploma with an average grade of 4.0/5.0 For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: Bakalavr or Specialised Diploma with an average grade of 4.5/5.0 For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: Magistr Diplomu (Masters degree) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Bulgaria | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: the Diploma za Sredno Obrazovanie/ Diploma za Zavarsheno Poluvisshe Obrazovanie with a minimum score of 4/ Dobur (good) and two state matriculation exams with grades 4 and 4. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 5 within your Diploma for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Bakalavr (Bachelor or Professional Bachelor) with a minimum score of 4/ Dobur (good). For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 6 within your Diploma for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: The pre-2017 Irish Leaving Certificate (ILC) or the pre-2017 Leaving Certificate Vocational Programme (LCVP) with a minimum score of HC3 in three subjects and passes in three other subjects (higher or ordinary levels) including Mathematics and English The post-2017 Irish Leaving Certificate (ILC) or the post-2017 Leaving Certificate Vocational Programme (LCVP) with at least four subjects at minimum grade H4, where a specific A-level subject is required for the degree programme, and a minimum grade O5, where GCSE Grade 4 English and/or Mathematics is required For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/china
Title: China | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more than 30 years we have worked closely with higher education institutions, agents and our alumni network in China. Some of our partners in China include: China Communication University, Beijing Foreign Studies University, Guangdong University of Foreign Studies, Tianjin Foreign Studies University, Donghua University, Southwestern University of Finance and Economics and many other 211 and 985 universities. Our links span a range of activities from student and staff exchange, collaborative teaching and progression opportunities for Chinese students to extensive research projects and networks. As the first institution in the United Kingdom to specialise in modern spoken Chinese, we have a long and proud history of welcoming Chinese students and staff to our London campuses and delivering teaching locally. Our admissions team, international recruitment team and senior academic staff regularly visit China. We look forward to meeting applicants, alumni and partners in China. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . We have a dedicated team based in London, Beijing and Guangzhou who are ready to help and support prospective students, alumni and our partners with any enquiry. The team can be contacted directly via [email protected] . Our Sina Weibo account: @威斯敏斯特大学; University Wechat Public Account：westminsteruni ; and China Team Wechat Account：westminsterchina 威斯敏斯特大学位于伦敦的"心脏"地带，是一座文理兼修、既有近二百年的历史底蕴又有现代的蓬勃激情的综合性大学。在大学的四个校区之中，有三个校区Regent Street，Cavendish，Marylebone 位于伦敦市中心，一个位于 Harrow地区，与著名的哈罗公学两两相望。可以说“伦敦就是我们的校园”，其地理位置的优越性是独一无二的。 威斯敏斯特大学历史悠久，前身是于 1838 年创建的英国皇家理工学院，是全英第一所理工院校，后于 1992 年成为综合性公立大学。 过去30多年以来，威斯敏斯特大学与中国一直保持着紧密的合作关系。不仅有遍布全国各地的中介、校友和企业网络，还与中国传媒大学、北京外国语大学、广东外语和外贸大学、天津外国语大学、东华大学、西南财经大学等几十所国内重点高校有教学和科研上的深度互动与合作。我们的中国传媒中心也长期为中国国务院新闻办公室，中国新闻出版总署，南方媒体集团，湖南广播影视集团等开设培训项目。 大学为国际学生提供的奖学金项目也是全英国规模最大的，其中包括专为中国学生设立的奖学金。大学共拥有三大书院（Colleges），十二大学院（Schools）, 开设300多门课程，涵盖媒体艺术、人文社科、建筑旅游、科学技术、法 学和商学领域，提供本科，硕士，博士课程以及 学前语言、HND Top-up 和短期学习项目(Study Abroad)。 威斯敏斯特大学现有在校学生 2 万多人，分别来自 160多个国家和地区，是最受国际学生欢迎的英国大学之一。大学多元的文化氛围使其成为了人与思想汇聚的中心和熔炉。威斯敏斯特大学的学生时时刻刻在伦敦国际化的氛围中接受熏陶，享受伦敦的一切便利和机会，拥有了更高的眼界和见识，也是各大雇主追捧的精英！ 我们位于北京和广州的中国办公室致力于为所有申请者提供最专业的建议和最有效的咨询和服务。请关注威斯敏斯特大学的官方微博和微信获取更多大学的介绍和讯息。 邮箱： [email protected] 新浪微博：@威斯敏斯特大学 大学微信公众号：westminsteruni 中国办公室微信：westminsterchina 中国官网： http://www.westminsteruniversity.cn Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: One year at a recognised university in China with an overall average of 70% (GPA 2.0/4) or above University College Graduation Diploma or a Graduation Diploma from Radio and TV Universities / Spare-time Universities / Training Colleges for Administrative cadres / Higher Education Self-Study Examinations or Adult Education at Zhuanke level with high grades DaZhuan or Zhuan Ke 2 year A recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or a Chinese institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% National High School Graduation Diploma or Gaokao results can be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please contact the Undergraduate admissions , Harrow Admissions or China Team at [email protected] for details To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor Degree Year Two completed from a recognised university in China with an overall average of 70% (GPA 2.0/4) or above Dazhuan three year Diploma in a relevant subject area with 70% (GPA 2.0/4) or above. If your diploma is in a closely related subject area, you may also be considered for entry into Year 3 of our Bachelor's degrees (Level 6) UK Higher National Diploma (HND) with grades CCC To be considered for entry into Year 3 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 6) , you wil typically need to have one of the following: Dazhuan three year Diploma in a closely related subject area with 70% (GPA 2.0/4) or above UK Higher National Diploma (HND) with grades BBB if studying a 3 Grade Unit SQA HND or BB if studying a 2 Grade Unit SQA HND For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor degree from 211, 985 or top national universities with an overall average grade of 70% Bachelor degree from national universities with an overall average grade of 75% Bachelor degree from high-ranking private universities with an overall average grade of 75% Master degrees with an overall average grade of 70% A recognised UK-based or China-based Pre-Master's qualification. Please contact the Postgraduate admissions , Harrow Admissions or China Team at [email protected] for details For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor degree from 211, 985 or top national universities with an overall average grade of 75% Bachelor degree from national universities with an overall average grade of 80% Bachelor degree from high-ranking private universities with an overall average grade of 80% Master degrees with an overall average grade of 75% A recognised UK-based or China-based Pre-Master's qualification. Please contact the Postgraduate admissions , Harrow Admissions or China Team at [email protected] for details For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Myanmar (Burma) | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into foundation courses , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor's (Honours) degree (4 years) Bachelor's (Pass) degree (3 years) For possible entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor's degree in professional subjects (4-5 years) a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or a Vietnamese institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Pre-Master's from a recognised pathway provider Bachelor's degree in professional subjects (4-5 years) Myanmar Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Title: Croatia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Svjedodžba o zavrsnom ispitu or Svjedodžba o (državnoj) maturi with an aggregated minimum score of 3.5 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 4 in English Language within Svjedodžba o (državnoj) maturi, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 3 in English Language within Svjedodžba o (državnoj) maturi, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. Note that if you achieve 8 or above within your Diploma di Esame di Stato for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 9 or above within your Diploma di Esame di Stato for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: Namibia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/czech-republic
Title: Czech Republic | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Maturitni Zkouška / Vysvedcení or Maturitní Zkoušce with an aggregated minimum score of 3. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 2 in English Language within Maturitni Zkouška, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following : Bakalář (Bachelor’s degree) with a minimum score of 2.5. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 1 in English Language within Maturitni Zkouška, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Our representatives are: UniLink W: unilink.cz If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . Title: Nepal | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65%< British Board A Levels or IB Diploma For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: 4-year Bachelor's degree from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 60% depending on the university 3-year Bachelor's degree from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 60% followed by a Master's degree depending on the university For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: Ivory Coast | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Diplôme d'Études Économiques Générales / Diplôme d'Études Juridiques Générales / Diplôme d'Études Universitaires Générales / Diplôme Universitaire d'Études Littéraires / Diplôme Universitaire d'Études Scientifiques French Baccalaureat a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60-65% For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: Diplôme d'Études Approfondies / Diplôme d'Études Supérieures / Diplôme d'Études Supérieures Spécialisées / Maîtrise with a score of 12-13/20 / Assez Bien from a recognised institution in Ivory Coast For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: Diplôme d'Études Approfondies / Diplôme d'Études Supérieures / Diplôme d'Études Supérieures Spécialisées / Maîtrise with a score of 14-15/20 / Bien from a recognised institution in Ivory Coast For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK first class degree , you will typically need to have: Diplôme d'Études Approfondies / Diplôme d'Études Supérieures / Diplôme d'Études Supérieures Spécialisées / Maîtrise with a score of 16/20 / Très Bien from a recognised institution in Ivory Coast For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Caribbean Advanced Proficiency Examination (CAPE) with Grade III or above in all subjects. Some courses such as Law, Media and Architecture may have higher requirements a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% A Levels associate degree (from University of West Indies and other tertiary Institutions) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page .
