English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: a Bachelor's degree with a score of B / GPA 2.00–2.99 / Second Class Lower Division For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: a Bachelor's degree with a score of B+ / GPA 3.00–3.59 / Second Class Upper Division For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK first class degree , you will typically need to have: a Bachelor's degree with a score of A / GPA 3.60+ / First Class For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Title: Japan | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Kotogakko Sotsugyo Shomeisho and the Scholastic Aptitude Test - SAT successful completion of 1 year at a recognised university in Japan with a GPA of 2.8 or above depending on the subject area a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or a Japanese institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% For consideration for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) you will typically need to have one of the following: Junior College 2 and 3 year diploma holders to have graduated from a College of Technology 5-year programme UK Higher National Diploma (HND) with Distinctions and Merits For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Holders of a good Bachelor's (Honours) degree from a recognised University with a GPA of 2.8, good B grade or approximately 65% For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . Title: Netherlands | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or year with us in London. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically have the following qualification: Voorbereidend Wetenschappelijk Onderwijs (VWO) with minimum scores of 6.5/6.5/6.5 in 3 most relevant subjects. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score 7 (Ruim Voldoende) in English Language within Voorbereidend Wetenschappelijk Onderwijs (VWO), then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Doctoraal, Getuigschrift Hoger Beroepsonderwijs (HBO) until 2002, and Bachelor's from 2002 and with a grade of no less than 6. Please note that this information should be used as a general guideline and qualifications not listed here may also be acceptable for entry. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score 9 (Zeer goed) in English Language within Voorbereidend Wetenschappelijk Onderwijs (VWO), then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: a 4-year Bachelor's degree from a recognised university in Jordan with a final grade of at least C/Good/68% or a GPA of 2.5/4.0 For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: a 4-year Bachelor's degree from a recognised university in Jordan with a final grade of at least B/Very good/75%+ or a GPA of 3.0/4.0 For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: Kenya | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Most recently, Dr Lynete Lusike Mukhongo, senior lecturer at Moi University in Kenya, has been awarded a fellowship at the Westminster Institute for Advanced Studies to research the impact of Kenya’s announcement to leave the International Criminal Court on social media. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: KCSE plus a recognised Foundation programme in a suitable subject area a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60-65% KCE plus one or more years of undergraduate studies at a reputable Kenyan university with an average grade of 60% / upper credit For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: a Bachelor's degree with 50% or C from a recognised Kenyan institution For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: a Bachelor's degree with 60% or B from a recognised Kenyan institution For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree from a recognised Kenyan institution For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Nigeria | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Student and alumni Community Nigerian students at Westminster actively engage in various extracurricular events and activities throughout the year, including sports clubs and societies. The list of prominent alumni in Nigeria includes Mo Abudu, a well-known media personality, producer and entrepreneur, and Don Omope, a Television Production BA Honours graduate and producer of the romantic comedy The Wedding Party, the highest-grossing film of all time in Nigeria. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: SSCE plus a recognised foundation programme in a suitable subject area a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% SSCE plus one or more years of undergraduate studies at a reputable Nigerian university with an average CGPA of 3.2 (Ordinary) National Diploma (OND/ND) with upper credit or distinction Higher National Diploma with credit For possible entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) , you will typically need to have the following: Higher National Diploma (HND) with upper credit or distinction For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Bachelor's degree with a minimum CGPA of 2.5/5.0 or 2.5/4 from a recognised Nigerian institution. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK Second Class Upper degree will need a CGPA of 3.5/5.0 or 3.0/4 and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need a GPA of 4.5/5.0 or 3.5/4 HND plus a Postgraduate Diploma with high grades Applicants without a first degree but with 5–7 years relevant work experience may also be considered on an individual basis for some Master's programmes a degree from a recognised Nigerian university may be accepted as evidence of English proficiency for most of our postgraduate programmes (with the exception of Master's courses in our Life Sciences department) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Norway | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have the following: Vitnemål fra den Videregående Skole (Vitnemål) (Leaving Certificate from Upper Secondary School) with a minimum average Vitnemål grade of 3. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 4 (god) or above with your Vitnemål for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following qualification: a Bachelorsgrad (Bachelor’s degree), Candidatus Magisterii, Sivilingeniør (siv. ing.) (Engineering degree), Siviløkonom (siv. øk.) (Economics degree) with a minimum grade C. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 5 (meget god) or above with your Vitnemål for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Our representatives are: SONOR Study Outside Norway W: sonor.no If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . Title: Estonia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Gümnaasiumi lõputunnistus with the Riigieksamitunnistus (Secondary School Leaving Certificate with the State Examination Certificate) Lõputunnistus Keskehariduse Baasil Kutseõppe Läbimise Kohta with the Riigieksamitunnistus (Certificate of Vocational Education Based on Secondary Education) Lõputunnistus Keskerihariduse Omandamise Kohta with the Riigieksamitunnistus (Certificate of Secondary Vocational Education) with a minimum grade 3 and 60 points in state examinations For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 70% in the English state examination within Gümnaasiumi lõputunnistus, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Diploma of Associate Engineer (DAE) with an overall average of 58% or above 2 year Bachelor degree (pass) with an overall average of 60% or CGPA 3.0+ or Division 1 or above depending on the University a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% For possible entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) , you will typically need to have one of the following: 3-year Bachelor's degree with an overall average of 60% or CGPA 3.0+ or Division 1 or above depending on the university UK Higher National Diploma (HND) with Distinctions and Merits For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: 3-year Bachelor's degree (Honours) in Technical subject from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 65% or CGPA 3.5 out of 4 or above may be considered depending on the university 4-year Bachelor's degree from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 58% or CGPA 2.8 out of 4 depending on the university 2-year Master's degree from an accredited university with a minimum overall average of 58% or CGPA 2.8 out of 4 or Division 1 depending on the university For more details on the application process, visit our Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page How to apply page . For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor's degree/Licence/Diplôme of at least 4 years in duration(14/20, 70% or a GPA of 2.8/4.0) Maîtrise/Magistere Diplôme d'Etudes Supérieures (Diploma of Higher Studies) For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor's degree/Licence/Diplôme of at least 4 years in duration(16/20, 80% or a GPA of 3.2/4.0) Maîtrise/Magistere Diplôme d'Etudes Supérieures (Diploma of Higher Studies) For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree Prestigious institutions American University of Beirut Beirut Arab University Beirut University College Centre d'Etudes Supérieures Haigazian College Holy Spirit University of Kaslik Institute of Islamic Studies Lebanese American University (formally Beirut University College) Lebanese University University of Balamand University of Luwayzeh Université St Joseph For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Title: Lesotho | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: National Diploma / University Diploma a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: Master's degree with a score of 70-74%/ B from a recognised institution in Lesotho For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: Master's degree with a score of 75-79%/ A/B+ from a recognised institution in Lesotho For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK first class degree , you will typically need to have: Master's degree with a score of 80-100%/ A from a recognised institution in Lesotho For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Poland | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: the new Matura/Swiadectwo Dojrzałości with Post-2005 (‘new’) Matura examinations with minimum grades of 60%/60%/60% in basic level examinations. Note that some courses include specific subject and grade requirements For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 70% or above in Advanced/Extended English Language within your Matura, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following qualification: a Licencjat/Inżynier (Bachelor’s degree) with a minimum score of 4 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 80% or above in Advanced/Extended English Language within your Matura, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives The University of Westminster's representatives in Poland can help you with all stages of the admissions process. Our representatives are: Elab Education Laboratory W: elab.edu.pl If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Read the blog Useful websites British Council Poland Polish Embassy in London UK Council for International Student Affairs Prepare for Success Student Finance England European Commission: Education and Training Contact us Contact the Course Enquiries Team: [email protected] Opening hours: 10am-4pm Monday to Friday

Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/portugal
Title: Portugal | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Our university has an Exchange Partnership with Universidad de Aveiro . Students from the partner institution may be eligible to participate in an exchange programme in one of our faculties. For further details download our student exchange partners list below Student Exchange Partners 260.61 KB Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following qualification: Diploma Nível Secundário de Educação/Certificado Nível Secundário de Educação with a minimum average grade of all year 12 exams of 14. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 15 within your Diploma Nível Secundário de Educação for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Licenciado or Diploma de Estudos Superiores Especializados (DESE) with a minimum overall grade of 13. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 17 within your Diploma Nível Secundário de Educação for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives The University of Westminster's representatives in Portugal can help you with all stages of the admissions process. Our representatives are: OK Student W: okstudent.com If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Read the blog Useful websites British Council Portugal Portuguese Embassy in London UK Council for International Student Affairs Prepare for Success The Student Room Student Finance England European Commission: Education and Training Contact us Contact the Course Enquiries Team: [email protected] Opening hours: 10am-4pm Monday to Friday

Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/oman
Title: Oman | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Arabic Information sheet (PDF) 2.19 MB Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: 2-year Diploma from a recognised institution a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% A Levels or International Baccalaureate For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: Bachelor's degree from a recognised institution with a minimum class of 2:2 and a minimum GPA of 2.8/4.0 For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: Bachelor's degree from a recognised institution with a minimum class of 2:1 and a minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0 For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day More events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives The University of Westminster's representatives in Oman can help you with all stages of the admissions process. Our representatives are: Muscat Global Study UK 4th Floor, Office 45, Ibn Awaa WayWay 361, Building 5965 Seeb, Oman T: +968 9521 2672 E: [email protected] W: www.globalstudyuk.com IDP Nizwa house (Behind Al Madina Plaza) Madinat Al Sultan Qaboos Sultanate of Oman Atahibah Oman Office Manager: Kala Rao T: 00 968 24 696452 F: 00 968 24 696 451 E: [email protected] W: www.idp.com/oman If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Read the blog Useful websites British Council Oman Oman Cultural Attaché Office in London UK Council for International Student Affairs Prepare for Success UK Visas and Immigration Sultanate of Oman Ministry of Higher Education Kaplan International College London Arabic website Contact us Contact the Course Enquiries Team: [email protected] Opening hours: 10am-4pm Monday to Friday

Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/greece
Title: Greece | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Apolytirion of Geniko Lykeio (previously Apolytirion of Eniaio Lykeio) with a minimum average grade 16. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 17 in English Language within Apolyterion, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Ptychio awarded by AEA/AEN/TEI with a minimum score 5.0–6.4. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 19 in English Language within Apolyterion, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives We have agents and international officers representing University of Westminster in Greece and around the world. Our representatives Alpha Academic Consultants W: alphaconsultants.net CES Bureau of Counselling in Education and Services W: ces.com.gr NETWORK EDUCATIONAL SERVICES W: network.gr If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Title: Romania | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need the following qualification: Diplomă de Bacalaureat with a minimum grade 7.5. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve B2 in all elements within your Diploma de Bacalaureat for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Diploma de Licenţă, Diploma di Inginer or Diploma de Architect with minimum grades 6-7. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve B2 in all elements within your Diploma de Bacalaureat for English Language then this is equivalent to IELTS 6.0. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Title: Russia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Entry Requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% A Levels or International Baccalaureate For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:2 degree , you will typically need to have: Bakalavr or Specialised Diploma with a CGPA of 3.5 For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: Bakalavr or Specialised Diploma with a CGPA of 4.0 For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. Note that if you achieve 2 or above in your English Language within Maturita, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: Rwanda | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. Title: Indonesia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: D2 Diploma with good grades Successfully completion of 1 year at a recognised university in Indonesia with a good grade a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or an Indonesian institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% A Levels or International Baccalaureate – check our course pages for details For consideration for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 5) , you will typically need to have one of the following: D3 Diploma with exceptionally high grades Higher National Diploma (HND) with upper credit or distinction For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Indonesian S1 (Sarjana) or Diploma IV (D4) also known as Sarjana Terapan (S.Tr.) GPA 2.6 from an A accredited dept GPA 2.8 from B accredited dept For entry to a Master's degree that requires a UK 2:1 degree , you will typically need to have: Indonesian S1 (Sarjana) or Diploma IV (D4) also known as Sarjana Terapan (S.Tr.) GPA 2.8 from an A accredited dept GPA 3.0 from B accredited dept For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives We have agents and international officers representing University of Westminster in Indonesia and around the world. See our representatives International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Korean alumni Westminster now boasts a wide network of highly successful Korean alumni who have taken their skills and experience onto a global platform in countries all over the world. If you are a Westminster alumnus and would like to be kept informed of events and benefits, please have a look at the Westminster Alumni pages . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: A recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% Successful completion of the first year at a recognised University in South Korea with a minimum GPA of 2.8 (depending on subject area) Junior College Diploma/Junior Vocational College Diploma To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: Bachelor's (Haksa) Degree from a recognised University For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Relevant 4 year Bachelor's (Haksa) degree from a well recognised institution with an overall GPA of 2.8/4.0 or above, depending on the subject area Bachelor's (Haksa) degree from a recognised institution and 2-3 years relevant work experience For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . Title: Ethiopia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following qualifications: Master's degree with at least GPA 3.0 out of 4.0 / Grade B from a recognised Ethiopian institution. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need a Master's degree with at least 3.5 out of 4.0. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Spain | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that under the Erasmus+ Programme , the first loans for graduates taking their Master's degree abroad are now available through MicroBank in Spain (the social branch of La Caixa) that will provide up to 30 million € of loans to Spanish Master students moving to another country to take up a degree over the next three years. A postgraduate loan is also available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Our university has a number of Exchange Partnerships with Spanish HE Institutions. Students from these partner institutions may be eligible to participate in an exchange programme. For further details download the list of student exchange partners- Student Exchange Partners 260.61 KB Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Titulo de Bachillerato or the Selectividad with a minimum average mark of 6 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 8 or above in English Language within Bachillerato, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a Licenciado/Título de Ingeniero/Título de Arquitecto with a minimum average of 6.0. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 9 or above in English Language within Bachillerato, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page .
