Title: Germany | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Abitur, Allgemeinen Hochschulreife, Fachgebundenen Hochschulreife, Fachhochschulreife with a minimum aggregate of 3.5 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 2 (gut) within your Abitur for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Magister Artium/Fachhochschul-Diplom/Erstes Staatsexamen (First State Examination), Bachelor's degree with a minimum score 3.5-2.6 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 1 (sehr gut) within your Abitur for English Language, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Title: Sri Lanka | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Westminster works very closely with Informatics Institute of Technology (IIT) . You can study for a Westminster degree programme in Sri Lanka and may be eligible to transfer your credit to and from Colombo and London. The programmes offered at IIT are BA Business Management BEng Software Engineering BSc Computer Science BSc Business Information Systems BSc Business Data Analytics MSc Advanced Software Engineering MSc Cyber Security and Forensics MSc Information Technology MA Fashion Business Management If you are currently studying at IIT and would like to enquire about continuing your studies at the University of Westminster, please contact [email protected] for further details. Sri Lankan alumni Westminster now boasts a wide network of highly successful Sri Lankan alumni who have taken their skills and experience onto a global platform in countries all over the world. I haven’t seen any other university in the UK which offers such a wide range of courses in all subject areas which allowed me to find the exact course I was looking for. Rukmal Hettiarachchi, MSc Advanced Information Technologies Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Sri Lankan A Levels with grade requirements depending on the course of study but typical from CCS (excluding English) NCC Foundation Course in Business and IT To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have one of the following: NCC International Diploma in Computer Studies (IDCS) with a credit average or above UK Higher National Diploma (HND) with Distinctions and Merits For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. In addition to the above entry requirements, you will need to meet our English language requirements . University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a Master's degree, you will typically need to have one of the following: UK degree with good lower second class or above (Note: Informatics Institute of Technology transfer students please refer to Westminster partners in Sri Lanka) 3 year Bachelor's degree (general) with an overall average of 70% or Grade A or above 4 year Bachelor's degree (special) with an overall average of 60% or Grade B+ or above For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60 per cent and 65 per cent One year of university studies at a recognised Brazilian institution To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: Nível Tecnológica (Post 1996 reform) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Bacharel/Licenciado/Professional title (4 years or more) with a minimum grade of 6.5 (depending on the institution and course applied for) Especialista High grades from a Bachelor's degree from a non-prestigious institution followed by a Master's degree High grades from a Bachelor's degree from a non-prestigious institution followed by one to three years' relevant full-time work experience For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Title: Swaziland | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference, and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Higher Diploma / Diploma from the University of Botswana a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Masters degree with at least 2nd class 2nd division / C average / 60-69% from a recognised institution in Botswana.  Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need a 2nd class 1st division / B average / 70-79%, and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need a 1st class / A average / 80-100% For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Sweden | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Our university has Exchange Partnerships with a number of Swedish HE Institutions, including Lund University and Stockholm University. Students from these partner institutions may be eligible to participate in an exchange programme. For further details download our student exchange partners list below Student Exchange Partners 260.61 KB Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Gymnasieexamen/Yrkesexamen (replacing in June 2014 Avgångsbetyg/ Slutbetyg från Gymnasieskola - Upper Secondary School Leaving Certificate) with minimum 2250 credits plus grades in three relevant subjects: CDD (previously VG/G) an adult education diploma (Kommunal Vuxenutbildning or Komvux) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve B in English Language within Gymnasieexamen, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve A in English Language within Gymnasieexamen, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Maturity Certificate / Maturitätszeugnis / Maturitätsausweis / Certificat de Maturité Berufsmaturität / Fachmaturität (Specialised Maturity Certificate for Applied Sciences programmes only) with a minimum average score 4 out of 6 (maximum) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 5/gut/bien/bene in English Language within Maturity Certificate, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Diplôme awarded by an École Supérieure Spécialisée, Diplôme d'État and Licence 4 (1-6 max scale), 6-7 (1-10 max scale) and 3 (5-1 max scale). For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve 6/Hervorragend/Excellent/Eccellente, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/taiwan
Title: Taiwan | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to a foundation course , you will typically need to have the following: Senior High School leaving certificate or Senior Vocational High School leaving certificate with a minimum GPA of 2.8/4 (70%) depending on the course applied for For entry to Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Successful completion of one year at a recognised university in Taiwan with a minimum GPA of 2.8 (70% depending on the course applied for Junior College Diploma with a minimum GPA of 2.8 (70%) depending on the course applied for To be considered for entry to Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: Very high grades in the Junior College Diploma For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: 4-year Bachelor's degree with minimum GPA of 2.8 (70%), depending on the University attended and course applied for 3-year Junior College Diploma plus a 2 year ‘top-up degree programme’ from a recognised Higher Education Institution with minimum GPA of 2.8 (70%) depending on the University attended and course applied for For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives The University of Westminster's representatives in Taiwan can help you with all stages of the admissions process. See our representatives International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Read the blog Useful websites British Council Taiwan UK Council for International Student Affairs Prepare for Success UK Visas and Immigration Contact us Contact the Course Enquiries Team: [email protected]

Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/belgium
Title: Belgium | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Certificat d'Enseignement Secondaire (CESS) Diploma Secundair Onderwijs Abschlusszeugnis der Oberstufe des Sekundarunterrichts with a minimum score of 14 out of 20 or 60% (Satisfaction/ Voldoening) For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a score of 16 in English in your Final Diploma, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a Bachelor’s degree / Licenciaat / Licencie with a minimum score of 10/ 60% For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a score of 18 in English in your Final Diploma, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Title: Ukraine | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Follow the University of Westminster on VK . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or an institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% A Levels or International Baccalaureate (see course pages for more information) To be considered for entry to Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: Bakalavr with Year 1 and Year 2 completed CGPA 4.0 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Bakalavr or Specialised Diploma (Students applying for Master's courses requiring a UK Second Class Upper degree will need a GPA of 4.5. Students applying for courses requiring a UK Second Class Lower degree will need a GPA of 4.0) Master's degree for Research (PhD) programmes Dyplom Magistra (Magister Diploma) for Research (PhD) programmes Successful completion of a Bachelor's degree qualifies students for the Kaplan International College London Pre-Masters. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: A Levels or International Baccalaureate (see course pages for more details) Associate degree (American University in Dubai) University Diploma a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: 4 year Bachelor's degree from a recognised university with 75%+ average for Master's courses requiring a UK Second Class Lower degree 4 year Bachelor's degree from a recognised university with 80%+ average for Master's courses requiring a UK Second Class Upper degree Kaplan Graduate Diploma (progression to Westminster Master's degrees) Master's degree for Research (PhD) programmes For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . Title: Tanzania | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . The University of Westminster’s Africa Media Centre promotes collaborative research on African film, media, communication and social change, and often hosts conferences and guest lectures in London. The centre organised several events last year, including the African Film and Politics Conference, African Film and Social Change, Media and Elections in Africa Conference and Documenting Africa: Creating Fact or Fiction through the Lens. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Advanced Certificate of Secondary Education (ACSE) Cambridge Overseas Higher School Certificate (COHSC)/East African Advanced Certificate of Education (EAACE) A recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% Post-CSE Technical College Certificate (3 years) To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: The Advanced Diploma For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Bachelor's degree with a minimum 2:2 from a recognised Tanzanian institution Professional Bachelor's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representative or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/uzbekistan
Title: Uzbekistan | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Follow the University of Westminster on VK. Between 7–16 June 2016, Westminster International University in Tashkent (WIUT) welcomed Politics and International Relations students from the University of Westminster for the first ever jointly delivered WUIT-UoW Exchange Summer School 2016. Students taking part in the visit wrote about their experiences – you can read their blogs here: Life Happens Around the Table Uzbekistan in Person The End of a Journey Eyeopening and Unforgettable Westminster International University in Tashkent (WIUT) The University is very proud to have had a long-standing partnership with the Westminster International University in Tashkent (WIUT) since 2002. WIUT provides internationally recognised programmes at undergraduate and postgraduate levels which are designed and validated in partnership with the University and are subject to the same quality assurance and control regulations as those taught in the UK. Students from WIUT also have the option to transfer/ continue their studies at bachelor or master’s level at the University of Westminster in London via various progression routes. Transfer study options for students from WIUT to the University of Westminster, London If you are currently studying at WIUT and would like to enquire about continuing your studies at the University of Westminster (UoW) in London, please contact WIUT International Studies section (Sharon Seow Yee Ang) via email [email protected] or the International Partnerships Team in London. You can also request an e-copy of the WIUT/UoW Student Transfer Guide by emailing [email protected] . This guide includes detailed information about courses and levels at UoW that permit transfer of studies from WIUT, the application process and the FAQs students may have. As a WIUT student, you will be also eligible for a 15% student fee discount for each year of your studies at the University of Westminster in London which will be applied upon enrolment. For information or enquiries about student exchanges, please visit the relevant pages on our website or contact the Education Abroad team . Please note that not all courses permit transfer of studies, therefore applications will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis. Students will need to fulfil relevant academic entry requirements for a selected level and course at UoW before an offer can be made, as well as satisfying applicable UK visa requirements. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into foundation courses , you will typically need to have: O'rta Ma'lumot To'g'risida Shahodatnoma (Certificate of Completed Secondary Education) with a grade of at least 56% For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60-65% A Levels or International Baccalaureate – check our course pages for details For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives and course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into a Master's degree requiring a UK 2:2 degree, you will typically need to have one of the following: Diplomi (Specialist Diploma) with a grade of 70% Bakalavr Diplomi (Bachelor's degree) with a grade of 75% For entry into a Master's degree requiring a UK 2:1 degree, you will typically need to have one of the following: Diplomi (Specialist Diploma) with a grade of 80% Bakalavr Diplomi (Bachelor's degree) with a grade of 85% For entry to a research (PhD) programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives and course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Overseas representatives The University of Westminster's representatives in Uzbekistan can help you with all stages of the admissions process. Our representatives are: Westminster International University in Tashkent (WIUT) If you are currently studying at WIUT and would like to enquire about continuing your studies at the University of Westminster (UoW) in London, please contact WIUT International Studies section (Sharon Seow Yee Ang) via email [email protected] . W: www.wiut.uz SIUK Uzbekistan www.studyin-uk.com/uzbekistan/contact/global-offices/tashkent If you wish to raise anything about the services provided by our representatives, you can contact us at [email protected] . Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/united-kingdom
Title: United Kingdom | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Many international students applying to Westminster are already based in the UK studying on A-level, International Baccalaureate and foundation courses across the country. Our international recruitment team regularly attends many school, college and agent events throughout the UK, where they provide further information about our courses, application process and entry requirements. Please attend one of these events to discuss your application in person. You may also be interested in attending one of our open days , which is a great way to meet staff and students and get a feel for what it is like to study at Westminster. If you are unable to visit the University during an open day, you are welcome to come to one of our campus tours . If you are a teacher or careers advisor and would be interested in us visiting your school or college, please contact us . Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry into Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65%* GCE A Levels International Baccalaureate To be considered for entry into Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have: successfully completed the first year of undergraduate studies in the UK For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a good honours Bachelor's degree a recognised Pre-Master's course from a UK institution (see the University preparation courses information below) For entry into a MPhil/PhD programme , you will typically need to have: a Master's degree For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details on this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/united-states-of-america
Title: United States of America | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . We have a long history of welcoming students from the US and developing strong research and cultural connections between both countries. Our relationship with the US can be traced back to 1886, when the founder of the Regent Street Polytechnic and notable philanthropist Quintin Hogg visited New York City, Chicago, Denver and Fort Collins to meet with some of the former Polytechnic fellows who had settled there. The strong connection with the US continues to this day with hundreds of American students choosing Westminster as their study destination abroad. Westminster also has a number of partnerships with American institutions, including Fashion Institute of Technology in New York, University of Miami, George Mason University, Johns Hopkins University and several Smithsonian museums in Washington DC. For further details see our Global Westminster pages. We welcome many American students to our International Summer Programme and Study Abroad programme , offering you an exciting opportunity to study in London for one or two semesters. Our Study Abroad programme is one of the oldest and best established programmes in the UK. We are a proud Generation Study Abroad Commitment partner and we are pleased to be consistently ranked as the top destination for US Study Abroad students in the UK. US student loans The University of Westminster is certified by the US Department of Education to support your application for federal aid and private loans to help you with your tuition fee and living costs. For more information please visit our US loans section or contact our US loans team . Studying for your undergraduate degree in England will usually mean a commitment of three years, or four years if you decide to take advantage of a work placement (co-op) year or a year with an overseas partner as part of your programme. Master's programmes usually take one year to complete. Course fees are listed on individual course pages, but as a guide, tuition is approximately $19,300 per year for undergraduate courses, and between $19,000 – $27,0000 for a one year Master's. It’s good to make sure you have an idea of overall costs when you are researching study options. You can see our affordable London guidance to help you with working out your budget and getting a better understanding of the real costs of studying with us. Do also check all the helpful information on our US loans page , which includes some cost of attendance guidance. Student and alumni community American students at Westminster are actively engaged in a range of extracurricular events and activities throughout the year, including a vast range of sports clubs such as basketball, American football and cheerleading , and more than 70 societies , ranging from Harry Potter and Anime to Law and Entrepreneurship societies. The US is also home to one of the largest groups of Westminster alumni with more than 6,500 alumni. The list of prominent alumni in the States includes Arthur Max, Oscar nominated and BAFTA winning art director (Gladiator, Robin Hood, Kingdom of Heaven and The Martian) and Al Shux, music producer and songwriter who has worked with Alicia Keys, Snoop Dogg, and Jay-Z on the Grammy winning hit song Empire State of Mind. Watch our films for an insight into what it's like to study at Westminster as an American student: Our American students discuss their experiences in London and differences between American and British education Our Film BA students share their experiences and advice to American students wishing to study Film at Westminster Interview with DiMitri Martin, an American student on Film BA course Our American Study Abroad students discuss their experiences in London and at Westminster Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4), you will typically need to have one of the following: High School Diploma with a minimum GPA of 3.0 (or GED) plus at least one of the following: New SAT: overall score of 1180 (post-2016) with a minimum of 570 in Maths and 610 in evidence-based reading and writing (essay is not required) Old SAT: 1800 (pre-2016) with a minimum of 550 in each element ACT score of 25+ AP exams in relevant subjects (AP tests or SAT subject tests are mandatory for courses that list required subjects in A Levels, eg BSc Biomedical Sciences requires two science subjects A combination of AP exams and SAT subject tests or IB Diploma Courses with no subject overlap will also be considered A minimum three individual IB Diploma Courses with no subject overlap Satisfactory completion of one year of a college/university programme with a GPA of 2.8 or above For consideration for entry to Year 2 of a Bachelor's degree (Level 5), you will typically need to have: an Associate degree (2 years) with a GPA of 2.8 or above Westminster accepts scores directly from ACT and the College Board. Our ACT Code is 7016 and our College Board Designated Institution code is 7385. UK A Level grade A is comparable to an AP score of 5 or SAT subject test score of 680 UK A Level grade B is comparable to an AP score of 4 or SAT subject test score of 650 UK A Level grade C is comparable to an AP score of 3 or SAT subject test score of 580 For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Four-year Bachelor's degree with a minimum GPA of 2.8+ from an accredited institution. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK Second Class Upper degree will need a GPA of 3.0 and those applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need a GPA of 3.5 Master's degree for MPhil/PhD entry Students are not required to take GRE or GMAT exams For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. For entry to Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: Bachiller a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Title: Thailand | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. Watch our Thai student share her study experiences: Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. For entry to Year 1 of Bachelor's degrees (Level 4) , you will typically need to have one of the following: successful completion of 1 year at a recognised university in Thailand with a minimum GPA of 2.6 or above depending on the subject area and institution attended a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution or a Thai institution following a validated UK syllabus. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60% and 65% A Levels or International Baccalaureate (see course pages for details) To be considered for entry to Year 2 of Bachelor's degrees (Leve l 5) , you will typically need to have the following: a Bachelor's degree from a non-prestigious university For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Foundation Certificate leading to entry to a broad range of our Bachelor's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . The University of Westminster accepts the Pre Sessional English Language course offered by Westminster International for entry to courses in 2024/25. Westminster International Pre Sessional Course Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: a relevant 4-year Bachelor's degree from a well-recognised Thai institution. GPA requirements will vary according to the course applied for and the Thai institution attended. Students from very prestigious institutions will be considered with an overall GPA of 2.6 or above depending on the subject area chosen. Students from less prestigious institutions should have a GPA of 2.8 or above. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our overseas representatives or course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. If you find that your qualifications do not meet our entry requirements, you may want to consider applying for one of the University preparation courses offered by our partner college – see below for details. University preparation courses Our partner college, Kaplan International College London, offers a Pre-Master's course leading to entry to a number of our Master's degrees. To find out more and apply, visit the Kaplan International College London website. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . The University of Westminster accepts the Pre Sessional English Language course offered by Westminster International for entry to courses in 2024/25. Title: Trinidad and Tobago | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: Caribbean Advanced Proficiency Examination (CAPE) with Grade III or above in all subjects. Some courses such as Law, Media and Architecture may have higher requirements. A Levels Associate degree (from University of West Indies and other tertiary Institutions) a recognised International Foundation course from a UK institution. Entry requirements vary but we normally ask for between 60– 65% For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a Bachelor's degree with a score of B/GPA 2.00–2.99/Second Class Lower Division. Students applying for postgraduate courses requiring a UK 2:1 degree will need B+/GPA 3.00–3.59/Second Class Upper Division Students applying for a course requiring a UK First Class degree will need A/GPA 3.60+/First Class For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . Url: https://www.westminster.ac.uk/international/your-country/slovenia
Title: Slovenia | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep. Our students join us from over 160 nations and we boast a worldwide alumni community to join when you graduate. For more information on what London and the University of Westminster can offer you, have a look at our Student life pages . Keep in mind that a postgraduate loan is now available to all UK/EU students to help pay for Master’s courses. For details, have a look at our EU, EEA and Swiss students funding page . As an alternative to a full degree, have a look at our various study abroad programmes , where you can spend a summer, semester or  year with us in London. Entry requirements Undergraduate Postgraduate Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Bachelor's degree (eg a BA, BSc, BEng or LLB) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have the following: Maturitetno Spričevalo (Matura Certificate) or Poklicna Matura (Vocational Matriculation Certificate) with a minimum grade 3. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for an undergraduate degree page . To search or browse our undergraduate courses, visit our Undergraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 4 in English Language within Maturitetno spričevalo, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.0 (with 5.5 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Applying for a course If you are interested in studying for a Master's degree (eg MA, MSc or LLM) or research programme (eg MPhil or PhD) at the University of Westminster, you will need to check that you meet our entry requirements. We have included typical entry requirements below, but these are simply a guideline. Some courses may also have specific subject or grade requirements, which will be listed on individual course pages. You will typically need to have one of the following: a Univerziteni Diplomirani (University Diploma) a Diplomirani (a Professional Diploma) a Bachelor’s degree with minimum grade 7. For more details on the application process, visit our How to apply page Go to How to apply for a postgraduate degree page . To search or browse our postgraduate courses, visit our Postgraduate page . If your qualifications are not listed If your qualifications are not listed above, you may still be able to apply for entry to our courses – just get in touch with our course enquiries team via the contact details at the bottom of this page. English language requirements The English language requirements for our courses are provided on individual course pages as minimum IELTS scores. Note that if you achieve a minimum score of 5 in English Language within Maturitetno spričevalo, then this is equivalent to an IELTS score of 6.5 (with 6.0 in each component). For information about equivalent English language qualifications that are accepted by the University, please visit our English language requirements page . Online open days Join us at an online open day and get a feel for student life at the University of Westminster. You'll get a chance to: Speak to our academic staff Ask us any questions you may have about student finance and accommodation Find an online open day Events in your country At present, there are no planned events in your country. Please check back at a later date or explore our online open days or information sessions . International student blog If you have ever wondered what it’s like to study in London and at the University of Westminster, our international bloggers will be able to help. Our international students are sharing their experiences of adapting to life in the UK, making new friends for life, dealing with homesickness and fulfilling their dreams. Students with the Licence must also have substantial relevant work experience for entry onto a Master's course. Title: Turkey | University of Westminster, London
Info: Studying at the University of Westminster, you'll be in the heart of London – with all the opportunities the city has to offer on your doorstep.
